action.action-desc: Ms. Wilson of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To provide for a comfortable and safe temperature level in dwelling units receiving certain Federal housing assistance, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safe Temperature Act of 2023.

section.header: Comfortable and safe temperature level in Federally assisted housing

subsection.text: The United States Housing Act of 1937 (42 U.S.C. 1437 et seq.) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in section 8(o)(13) (42 U.S.C. 1437f(o)(13)), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The Secretary may require the owner of a dwelling unit receiving assistance under a housing assistance payment under this paragraph to ensure that the dwelling unit maintains a comfortable and safe temperature level ranging from 71 degrees to 81 degrees Fahrenheit.

paragraph.text: in section 9 (42 U.S.C. 1437g), by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Use of funds To maintain temperate level in units
subsection.text: With respect to a public housing dwelling unit, the Secretary may use amounts in the Capital Fund or the Operating Fund to ensure that the dwelling unit maintains a comfortable and safe temperature level ranging from 71 degrees to 81 degrees Fahrenheit.
Section 202 of the Housing Act of 1959 (12 U.S.C. 1701q) is amended by striking the last two subsections (each designated as subsection (m)) and inserting the following:

The Secretary may require the owner of housing assisted under this section to ensure that each unit in that housing maintains a comfortable and safe temperature level ranging from 71 degrees to 81 degrees Fahrenheit.
